    • Method Detail

      • switchToWord

        public void switchToWord(java.lang.String word)
        Switches the most recent output to the given String. This is only for the Levenshtein Distance computation. Note that this will mess up the distance computation for outputs longer than a word.
        Parameters:
        word - The String that replaced the original output.

      • simulateKeyPress

        public void simulateKeyPress(char c)
        Simulates a key press by changing the state of the key's rectangle.
        Parameters:
        c - The character

      • getLevenshteinSet

        public java.lang.String[] getLevenshteinSet()
        Retrieves the three Strings that correspond to the Levenshtein computation, the keyboard input, the output, and the Levenshtein Distance String.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of three Strings corresponding to the keyboard input, the output, and the Levenshtein Distance String.

      • getLastInputLevenshteinDistance

        public java.lang.String getLastInputLevenshteinDistance()
        Retrieves the Levenshtein Distance String of the most recent input and output.
        Returns:
        Returns the Levenshtein String.

      • addMouseCoordinates

        protected void addMouseCoordinates()
        Adds the mouse coordinates to the arraylist. Should be called by a TimerTask to prevent over-sensitivity.

      • generateFormattedString

        private java.lang.String[] generateFormattedString()
        Generates an array of formatted Strings. The array size is depenedent on the number of spaces that the user has inputted.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of the input Strings that are correctly formatted to be processed.

      • splitFormattedString

        private static java.lang.String[] splitFormattedString(java.lang.String formatted)
        Splits the formatted String based on spaces.
        Parameters:
        formatted - The whole formatted combination String.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Strings that were split by spaces.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        A mouse press will update the display state of the key and will begin the dragging state.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        A mouse release will update the display state of the key and will end the dragging state. In addition, the words will be computed from the inputted keys.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseEntered

        public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If the mouse enters, just put focus to the keyboard and the input text area.
        Specified by:
        mouseEntered in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseExited

        public void mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)

        mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
